item.title: A love letter to Raycast ❤️
item.description:
"What are the must-have apps to install on my new Mac?"… "Which tool makes you the most productive?"… "Do you still use Alfred?"…

All these questions and more—and the answer to all of them is Raycast!

item.title: My Favourite Tools on the Mac (Setting up a new Mac)
item.description: This is the software counterpart to my previous article in which I looked at my workstation’s hardware setup. Some of these are unique or best-of-breed, others may have been sherlocked but I stick with them anyway :)

item.title: Why I use Alfred App (and maybe you should too)
item.description: I’ve used Alfred for years, and it’s one of the first apps I’ll install on a fresh Mac. It’s like the Cmd-Space search integration that MacOS has, but so much more than that. Here’s a few of the really powerful features that makes it the first app I’ll reach for to install on any new Mac - and which it’ll feel like I’m trying to work with one arm tied behind my back if I don’t have :)

item.title: Searching Alfred's Clipboard history programatically
item.description: Alfred is one of my favourite productivity apps for the Mac. It’s a file indexer, a clipboard manager, a snippet expander - and that’s just scratching the surface really. I recently got a new machine without it installed and realised just how much I rely on Alfred, particularly its clipboard manager.

item.title: Migrating Alfred Clipboard to New Laptop
item.description:
